title: 2 Easy Ways to Show the Weather on Your iPhone Lock Screen

steps.title: Unlock your iPhone.
steps.content: Unlock your iPhone. If your iPhone is locked by Face ID and/or passcode, use it to unlock the device. You won't be able to make edits if your iPhone is locked. [1] X Research source Make sure to update your iPhone . You must have iOS 16 or newer to display the Weather app on your lock screen. If you're unsure if your device has the update, you can check if your iPhone can be updated .

steps.title: Long-press on your lock screen.
steps.content: Long-press on your lock screen. If you have multiple lock screens set up, you can swipe left and right to swap to the one you want to customize. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Customize.
steps.content: Tap Customize . This is the grey button below the lock screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your lock screen.
steps.content: Tap your lock screen. This will be the screen on the left side. [4] X Research source You'll now be in edit mode.

steps.title: Select the placement.
steps.content: Select the placement. You can choose to place the current weather conditions in line with the date and/or place a widget underneath the time. [5] X Research source If you want quick, simplified weather information, tap the date line. If you want to see more weather details, select the Add Widget field.

steps.title: Select the Weather widget.
steps.content: Select the Weather widget. Scroll down past the Suggestions to see the Weather widget option. [6] X Research source You can select specific information of the Weather app, such as Location , Conditions , UV Index , Sunrise and Sunset , Moon , Precipitation , Wind , and Air Quality . If you clicked the top placement, you'll see simplified information of the weather with icons and temperatures or location. If you clicked the Add Widget field, you can select between a small or full-sized widget, depending on what information you want to display. Swipe left and right to view the options, then tap it to add the widget.

steps.title: Click the lock screen to close the edit windows.
steps.content: Click the lock screen to close the edit windows. If the edit window is covering the full screen, tap the X in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This will be in the top-right corner. Your changes will be applied. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your lock screen.
steps.content: Tap your lock screen. This will return you to your active lock screen.

steps.title: View your Weather widget.
steps.content: View your Weather widget. When you wake your iPhone , you'll see the Weather widget in the placement you set. Your iPhone does not need to be unlocked to view the weather. If the iPhone is unlocked, you can click the Weather widget to open the Weather app. If the Weather widget is displaying the wrong city or weather, make sure to set a default city on the Weather app.

steps.title: Unlock your iPhone.
steps.content: Unlock your iPhone. If your iPhone is locked by Face ID and/or passcode, use it to unlock the device. You won't be able to make edits if your iPhone is locked. Make sure to update your iPhone. You must have iOS 16 or newer to use live wallpapers. This method will display a background that changes depending on your weather conditions.

steps.title: Long-press on your lock screen.
steps.content: Long-press on your lock screen. This will open your current lock screens. You'll need to create a new lock screen.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . This will be the blue button in the bottom-right corner. You can also swipe left, then tap the + to reach the Add New Wallpaper screen.

steps.title: Tap Weather.
steps.content: Tap Weather . This will be in the top, next to Emoji . You may need to tap and drag the icons towards the left to see it. [8] X Research source You can also select preset styles underneath the Weather & Astronomy header.

steps.title: Customize the lock screen.
steps.content: Customize the lock screen. You can add other widgets by tapping the date or Add Widgets field. You can also change the font and color of the time by tapping it. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This will be in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Set as Wallpaper Pair.
steps.content: Tap Set as Wallpaper Pair . This will also set the live wallpaper as your Home screen. [10] X Research source If you want a different Home screen, tap Customize Home Screen below. Set your customizations, then tap Done in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap your new lock screen.
steps.content: Tap your new lock screen. This will set the new lock screen as your current.

steps.title: View your live wallpaper.
steps.content: View your live wallpaper. When you wake your iPhone, you'll see the current weather conditions as your live wallpaper. If you want more details, you can use the previous method to add Weather widgets to your live wallpaper. You can also add Widgets to your Home screen .
